author: CNN Newsource
title: Virginia mom asks Taylor Swift fans for help with her daughter and boy did they respond
text:
Virginia mom asks Taylor Swift fans for help with her daughter and boy did they respond
Click here for updates on this story
CHESTERFIELD COUNTY, Virginia (
WTVR) — Like many mother-daughter relationships, Sarah Blanks and her daughter Abby have a special one. Along with a deep love for each other, the pair also share a love for Taylor Swift.
Mother Sarah claims she was a Swifty first.
“She was going through the same thing I was — heartbreak, friendships, friend struggles, you know, it’s all portrayed in her music,” Blanks, who is around Swift’s age, said.
It did not take much to convert daughter Abby.
“I shared, ‘Shake it Off,’ I think was the first one with my daughter when it first came out in 2014. She was four. And she would just dance and shake it off in her car seat and it’s just been a love story ever since then,” Blanks said.
Like her mom, Abby has been drawn to what Swift sings about.
“I just feel like as I’m getting older, I can go back and listen to her music that she made when she was struggling with the same things that I am now,” Abby said.
The pair have made several trips to Swift concerts — including the opening of her current Eras Tour.
As Abby approached her 13th birthday this year, her mom reached out to fellow Swift fans, known as Swifties, with a special request.
Blanks wrote a social media post asking fellow Swifties to send in cards to help Abby celebrate.
“Being a teenager is hard. Being a teenage girl is even harder. She’s had a lot of struggles this past year,” Blanks said. “All I wanted was to give her the best 13th birthday.”
Blanks said she expected about 20 cards to arrive.
But more than 250 were delivered from around the world.
Mom decorated the walls with the cards to surprise her Swiftie daughter.
“I didn’t think the cards were actually, like, actual cards. And then I started opening some, and they were actual cards from people all over the world. I was just completely shocked,” Abby said.
Among the cards, were things like friendship bracelets and jars of her quotes.
For Abby, the experience was a lesson in community.
“I just think it shows that you don’t really have to know someone for them to care about you,” Abby said.
“I have cried multiple times just thinking about it,” her mom shared. “I know I personally have struggled finding a community that supports me and I know that being a teenager is difficult to find a community. So I think it’s important to be able to show her what it looks like.”
Blanks and Abby said they’ll continue to watch Swift shows on tour and hope to be able to meet some of their fellow Swifties who helped make this a reality.
Please note: This content carries a strict local market embargo. If you share the same market as the contributor of this article, you may not use it on any platform.

一APP生活「Sync」到 《星島頭條》流動應用程式(APP)是一個結合生活、新聞資訊、視頻、個人化功能及生活實用小工具的綜合平台。 了解更多 關於我們 聯絡我們 隱私政策聲明 使用條款 版權及免責聲明 幫助及反饋 我要爆料 Copyright © 2024 SingTao Ltd.All rights reserved. 主頁 國際 即時國際 哈佛點名8大超級食物 有助降膽固醇還能穩定血壓 即時國際 更新時間：08:00 2024-01-06
發佈時間：08:00 2024-01-06 字體大小 許多民眾都有膽固醇過高的困擾，除了養成良好生活習慣外，調整飲食也很重要，哈佛醫學院一項統合分析研究指出，平時多吃燕麥、全穀類、豆類、秋葵及茄子、堅果類、植物油、魚油以及柑水果，有助降膽固醇、穩定血壓。
膽固醇是人體一種必需的物質，能夠製造膽汁、賀爾蒙與維持細胞的機能，人體血液中約有75％的膽固醇是來自肝臟製造，另外25％來自日常飲食，如果累積過多膽固醇，就會提高心血管疾病風險。
美國心臟協會（AHA）建議 ，平時多吃水果、蔬菜、低脂乳製品、瘦肉、含有Omega3脂肪酸的魚類、堅果類、豆類、植物油等，有助預防膽固醇過高。
看看哪些食物有益健康? 8大助降膽固醇食物 哈佛醫學院一項統合分析研究點名8大食物可以降低膽固醇、穩定血壓，第1是燕麥，燕麥含有可溶性纖維，可以搭配香蕉或其他水果當早餐；再來是全穀類，包括大麥或其他全穀類有豐富的纖維質，可以降低心臟疾病風險。
第3是豆類，富含可溶性纖維，可以增加飽足感，有助減重；第4為茄子及秋葵，這2種蔬菜熱量極低，是攝取纖維的好來源；第5是堅果，包括杏仁、核桃、花生、腰果等堅果含有健康油脂，適量攝取對心臟有益，還能將低約5％的膽固醇。
第6是植物油，使用橄欖油、芥花油、苦茶油取代動物性油脂，有助降低低密度脂蛋白；第7是水果，蘋果、葡萄、士多啤梨及柑橘類水果富含果膠，可以降低膽固醇；最後是魚油，每周吃2到3次富含Omega3脂肪酸的魚，有助降低低密度脂蛋白，還能保護心臟。
---

author: Ashraf
title: The Makkah Route Initiative Crucial to Pilgrims’ Peace and Tranquility
text:
The Makkah Route Initiative Crucial to Pilgrims’ Peace and Tranquility
The Makkah Route Initiative, a flagship project of the Ministry of Interior, covers seven countries and was designed to offer pilgrims not just best technical and logistical support, but also a sense of security.
The initiative is testament to the leadership's unwavering commitment to serving the Two Holy Mosques and their valued visitors.
As per the initiative, pilgrims are offered high-quality services, their entry procedures are streamlined, starting already in their home countries, and they are transported directly to their accommodations in Makkah and Madinah.
Due to the Makkah Route Initiative, the time pilgrims spend at points of entry into the Kingdom has been successfully reduced. This is an accomplishment that clearly demonstrates the Saudi government's commitment to providing a seamless pilgrimage experience, including by expediting entry procedures and by securing luggage-handling services that enable easy access to accommodations.
This year, the initiative has benefited pilgrims from seven countries: Morocco, Indonesia, Malaysia, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Türkiye, and Côte d'Ivoire; through it, special lounges have been dedicated for pilgrims at the airports in these countries.
The Makkah Route Initiative garnered international acclaim, with the Turkish ambassador to the Kingdom, Dr. Emrullah Isler, commending the initiative personnel’s hard work at Turkish airports in Ankara and Istanbul.
The Saudi Press Agency (SPA), present at Istanbul International Airport, captured pilgrims’ feelings vis-à-vis the initiative.
Speaking to SPA, Amina Turk, who is accompanied by her husband on the trip, said: “I wished to perform Hajj at the Grand Mosque, and I ask Allah to give us the ability to complete it. We are very excited because it is our first visit, and I ask Allah accepts our deed."
With a shared vision, various government agencies collaborate to ensures a secure and seamless experience for pilgrims. These are: ministries of interior, foreign affairs, health, Hajj and Umrah, and media, the General Authority of Civil Aviation, Saudi Data and Artificial Intelligence, the pilgrim experience program, which is one of the Kingdom's Vision 2030 programs, and the Zakat, Tax, and Customs Authority.

author: TOI Sports Desk
title: Jan Blachowicz Returns to Face Carlos Ulberg - The Man Who Stopped Israel Adesanya's Perfect MMA Run | MMA News - The Times of India
text:
Photo by Chris Unger/Getty Image UFC London on March 22 is flying under the radar, but it shouldn’t be. The main event sees welterweight champ Leon Edwards taking on Sean Brady, but the co-main? That’s where things get interesting. Jan Blachowicz, the former light heavyweight champion, is stepping back into the cage against Carlos Ulberg.
Blachowicz isn’t just any former champ—he’s the guy who stopped Israel Adesanya’s perfect MMA run. Back in 2021, he shut down ‘The Last Stylebender’ when Adesanya tried to become a two-division champion. Now, after more than a year away from the octagon, he’s back. And this fight? It could decide whether he still has one more title run left in him.
The Fight That Ended Israel Adesanya’s Unbeaten MMA Record Let’s rewind to 2021, Israel Adesanya was unstoppable. He had just wrecked Paulo Costa at UFC 253, making the undefeated Brazilian look completely out of his depth. With the middleweight division cleared out, Adesanya set his sights on making history—moving up to 205 pounds to take on Jan Blachowicz for the light heavyweight title at UFC 259.
Blachowicz had won that belt the same night Adesanya beat Costa, knocking out Dominick Reyes in brutal fashion. Reyes was the guy who had arguably beaten Jon Jones, but Blachowicz ran through him. Still, when the fight with Adesanya was booked, most people counted him out. The oddsmakers had Adesanya as the favorite. The narrative was set: Adesanya was too fast, too skilled, too slick.
But Blachowicz didn’t care about the hype. Over five rounds, he used his size, power, and smart grappling to completely shut Adesanya down. The UFC commentary team—Joe Rogan, Daniel Cormier, and Jon Anik—got blasted by fans for their clear Adesanya bias, but the scorecards told the real story. Blachowicz won a unanimous decision and handed Adesanya his first-ever MMA loss. The double-champ dream was over.
Jan Blachowicz vs. Carlos Ulberg: A Must-Win Fight
Since that massive win, Blachowicz has had a mixed run. He lost the title to Glover Teixeira, beat Aleksandar Rakic (due to injury), and then fought to a draw in a vacant title fight against Magomed Ankalaev. His last fight? A competitive loss to Alex Pereira in 2023.
Also Read: Leon Edwards’ 8-Second UFC Knockout: One of the Fastest Finishes in History
Now, he’s up against Carlos Ulberg, a rising contender who trains with none other than Israel Adesanya. Ulberg is on a seven-fight win streak with five finishes. A win here could catapult him into title contention. But for Blachowicz, this fight isn’t just about rankings—it’s about proving he’s still one of the best. If he pulls off another big win, the light heavyweight division will have to take notice.
Come fight night, we’ll find out if Blachowicz still has that legendary ‘Polish Power’ or if the new wave of contenders is ready to take over.

About the Author TOI Sports Desk The TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects. We deliver accurate, engaging, and up-to-the-minute sports content, round the clock. Read More
